abstract: Bank of America has promised lawmakers it won’t raise interest rates or suddenly change terms on customers’ credit cards ahead of the effective date of President Obama’s new credit card reform act.
snippet: Bank of America has promised lawmakers it won’t raise interest rates or suddenly change terms on customers’ credit cards ahead of the effective date of President Obama’s new credit card reform act.
lead_paragraph: Update | 5:19 p.m. Bank of America has promised lawmakers it won’t raise interest rates or suddenly change terms on customers’ credit cards ahead of the effective date of President Obama’s new credit card reform act.

headline.main: Bank of America Makes Pledge on Credit Card Act
